title: Governance Integrity Root Manifest (GIRM) V01
description: Defines the mandatory structure for the manifest used by GIRAM to verify system integrity and provenance.

manifestVersion.description: Version of this manifest schema (e.g., V01.0)

systemID.description: A unique identifier for the specific system or service instance this manifest pertains to.

signingKeyID.description: Identifier (usually a UUID) for the key used to sign this manifest, cross-referenced against GRTA (Governance Root Trust Anchor).

timestampUTC.description: The time the manifest was cryptographically committed.

cryptoPolicyRef.description: Reference pointer to the Secure Cryptographic Policy Interface (SCPI) version used for artifact hashing (e.g., SCPI-T03).

governanceActor.description: The specific governance entity that generated and asserted this manifest.

criticalArtifacts.description: List of files and components requiring integrity checks.

HashAlgorithm.description: Approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for integrity checks. Should align with referenced SCPI policy.

path.description: System absolute path or unique resource locator (URL/URN) to the artifact.

expectedHash.description: The canonical expected hash of the artifact content. Must be 64 to 128 hex characters (256-512 bits).
